summary: The Safe Transit Accountability Act (H.R. 4900) amends Title 49 of the United States Code to clarify the role of the accountable executive within a transit agency's safety committee. It designates the accountable executive as the final decision-maker regarding risk mitigation strategies recommended by the committee and as the tie-breaker in dispute resolution. The legislation aims to improve public transportation safety by defining responsibility for safety plans and resource allocation within transit agencies.
